references.paper_title: The merged-staircase property: a necessary and nearly sufficient condition for SGD learning of sparse functions on two-layer neural networks
references.reason: This paper establishes a theoretical framework for understanding the efficiency of gradient descent in learning sparse functions with two-layer neural networks, which is relevant to the study of low-dimensional structures in the target function class.

references.paper_title: Transformers learn to implement preconditioned gradient descent for in-context learning
references.reason: This paper demonstrates that transformers can implement a specific learning algorithm (preconditioned gradient descent) in their forward pass, providing a crucial mechanistic understanding of in-context learning.

references.paper_title: Online stochastic gradient descent on non-convex losses from high-dimensional inference
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical guarantees for the performance of gradient descent on non-convex loss functions in high-dimensional settings, which is a key component of the analysis of nonlinear transformers.

references.paper_title: Learning single-index models with shallow neural networks
references.reason: This paper studies the statistical efficiency of shallow neural networks in learning single-index models, providing a strong theoretical foundation for the analysis of transformers learning low-dimensional structures.

references.paper_title: What can transformers learn in-context? A case study of simple function classes
references.reason: This paper empirically investigates the in-context learning capabilities of transformers for simple function classes, laying the groundwork for the theoretical analysis of more complex nonlinear functions.
